thread.title_full: Kaabil box office collection: Hrithik Roshan's film earns Rs. 2 crore in Pakistan over the weekend - Bollywoodlife.com

author: Moumita Bhattacharjee
title: Kaabil box office collection: Hrithik Roshan's film earns Rs. 2 crore in Pakistan over the weekend - Bollywoodlife.com
text:
Deepika Padukone, Hrithik Roshan, Mahira Khan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan: Celebs grace magazine covers 
Kaabil is a film which is only getting better with every passing day. If its India box office numbers have been monumental, its run in Pakistan is simply inspirational. It was the first film to release after the ban on Indian films was lifted in our neighbouring country and it seems audience there is loving it. Over the weekend, Hrithik Roshan ‘s revenge drama has earned Rs. 2 crore. 
Kaabil earned Rs. 75 lakh on the first day which was simply great given the fact that the film was released there without any publicity campaign as it was a sudden development. We told you how there were reports of Dangal, Kaabil and Raees to hit the theatres post the ban. But Kaabil became the first one to get a go ahead and a simultaneous release. In fact, the film brought people back to the theatres. Kaabil released in Karachi last week at 11 pm and saw a wide release in Karachi, Islamabad, Rawal Pindi and Hyderabad. People loved the film there and have been tweeting about it a lot in last few days. Pakistan theatre owners are happy that Indian films are releasing there because the ban had affected their business a lot. (Also read: Kaabil box office collection day 12: Hrithik Roshan’s film passes the second weekend test, earns Rs 118.14 crore ) 
Satish Anand, head honcho of Eveready Group of Companies, the distributor of Hrithik Roshan starrer Kaabil in Pakistan had told IANS via social media: “Cine-goers are excited as after a long gap, two good films, that include ‘Raees’ (release date yet to be announced), are going to be seen on local Pakistani circuit. I’m sure this is a healthy beginning. In Pakistan, over 50 per cent decline in revenue collection was witnessed after Indian films were withdrawn from the theatres.” And he is right. Kaabil’s numbers are certainly saying that the film got much love in Pakistan. 
Stay tuned for more box office updates on Kaabil.
